intro: Sarcostemma forskaolianum, commonly known as the creeping milkweed, is a perennial climbing shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or yellowish flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Its latex sap is milky and contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid to humid environments.
